qas.question: What religious group was not allowed to settle in South Carolina?
About what year did Charleston cease to have the wealthiest Jewish community in America?
What European country did many of the first Charleston settlers come from?
After what war did the state ban on Catholics end?
Along with Bermuda, what other English colony did many settlers come from?
What religious group was allowed to settle in South Carolina?
About what year did Charleston begin to have the wealthiest Jewish community in America?
What European country did few of the first Charleston settlers come from?
After what war did the state ban on Catholics begin?
Along with Bermuda, what other English colony did few settlers come from?

context: The first settlers primarily came from <a2_0><b7_0>England<b7_0/><a2_0/>, its Caribbean colony of <a4_0><b9_0>Barbados<b9_0/><a4_0/>, and its Atlantic colony of Bermuda. Among these were free people of color, born in the West Indies of alliances and marriages between Africans and Englanders, when color lines were looser among the working class in the early colonial years, and some wealthy whites took black consorts or concubines. Charles Town attracted a mixture of ethnic and religious groups. French, Scottish, Irish, and Germans migrated to the developing seacoast town, representing numerous Protestant denominations. Because of the battles between English "royalty" and the Roman Catholic Church, practicing <a0_0><b5_0>Catholics<b5_0/><a0_0/> were not allowed to settle in South Carolina until after the <a3_0><b8_0>American Revolution<b8_0/><a3_0/>. Jews were allowed, and Sephardic Jews migrated to the city in such numbers that by the beginning of the 19th century, the city was home to the largest and wealthiest Jewish community in North America—a status it held until about <a1_0><b6_0>1830<b6_0/><a1_0/>.
